title: Fix Home page hero image visibility across breakpoints

requirements.summary: Update the Home page hero image layout/CSS so the full photo is always visible (no cropping) on mobile/tablet/desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Home page, the hero image is visible and loads successfully.
On mobile, tablet, and desktop widths, the full photo content is visible (no unintended cropping/cut-off).
The hero section layout remains stable (no overflow causing the image to disappear or be clipped).

file_operations.description: Adjust the hero image wrapper and styling to use a constrained aspect ratio and an object-fit strategy that preserves the entire photo (e.g., container with a consistent responsive aspect ratio + img sized to fill container using object-contain), and ensure no parent overflow/clipping hides the image at common breakpoints.

requirements.summary: Confirm the hero image static asset exists and that HomePage references the correct /assets/generated path so the image always loads.
acceptanceCriteria: The hero image request returns 200 (no broken image icon).
The in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx references the correct static path under /assets/generated/ for the hero image.

file_operations.description: Verify the hero src points to the correct generated asset path and filename (use the exact generated asset hero image path under /assets/generated), updating the reference if needed so it reliably loads in production builds.
Ensure the generated hero image asset exists at this exact static path for deployment (place/copy the provided generated file here if it is currently missing or located elsewhere).
